ukm:Metadata.dc:title: The Whole of Government Accounts (Designation of Bodies) Order 2010
ukm:Metadata.dc:publisher: Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament
ukm:Metadata.dc:subject: GOVERNMENT RESOURCES AND ACCOUNTS
ukm:Metadata.dc:description: This Order designates the bodies listed in the Schedule in relation to the financial year ending on 31st March 2010 for the purposes of the Government Resources and Accounts Act 2000. The effect of designation is that these bodies are required to prepare and present to the Treasury such financial information in relation to that financial year as the Treasury require to enable them to prepare Whole of Government Accounts.

ukm:UnappliedEffect.ukm:AffectedTitle: The Whole of Government Accounts (Designation of Bodies) Order 2010
ukm:UnappliedEffect.ukm:AffectingTitle: The Public Bodies (Abolition of British Shipbuilders) Order 2013

SecondaryPrelims.Title: The Whole of Government Accounts (Designation of Bodies) Order 2010

P.Text: The Treasury make this Order in exercise of the powers conferred by section 10(1) of the Government Resources and Accounts Act 2000.

Para.Text: In accordance with section 10(7) of that Act the Treasury have consulted the Welsh Ministers where they have thought it appropriate.

P1para.Text: This Order may be cited as The Whole of Government Accounts (Designation of Bodies) Order 2010 and shall come into force on 20th April 2010.

The bodies listed in the Schedule to this Order are designated in respect of the financial year ending on 31st March 2010 for the purposes of section 10 of the Government Resources and Accounts Act 2000.

Signee.JobTitle: Two of the Lords Commissioners of Her Majesty’s Treasury

Pblock.Title: Central Government, Public Corporations, Academies etc.

P.Text: This Order designates the bodies listed in the Schedule in relation to the financial year ending on 31st March 2010 for the purposes of the Government Resources and Accounts Act 2000. The effect of designation is that these bodies are required to prepare and present to the Treasury such financial information in relation to that financial year as the Treasury require to enable them to prepare Whole of Government Accounts.
A full Impact Assessment has not been prepared for this instrument as no impact on the private or voluntary sectors is foreseen.

Para.Text: 2000.c.20. Section 10 was amended by paragraph 57 of Schedule 10 to the Government of Wales Act 2006 (c.32).
